In Figure 1 we illustrate this method. The calculation of approximate modified duration
is based on a given change in YTM. V is the price of the bond if YTM is decreased by
AYTM and V, is the price of the bond if the YTM is increased by AYTM. Note that V_
> V. Because of the convexity of the price-yield relationship, the price increase (to V),
for a given decrease in yield, is larger than the price decrease (to V).
